title: Citi Guam Employees Among 2012 U.S. President's Volunteer Service Awardees
summary: Hagatna, Guam - Six Citi Guam employees were among 1,190 Citi U.S. employees qualified for the President's Volunteer Service Award. In total, these 1,190 employees gave nearly 332,000 volunteer hours in 2012.
tag-1: Citi Guam Employees Among 2012 U.S. President's Volunteer Service Awardees
tag-2: Hagatna, Guam – Six Citi Guam employees were among 1,190 Citi U.S. employees qualified for the President's Volunteer Service Award. In total, these 1,190 employees gave nearly 332,000 volunteer hours in 2012.
tag-3: The six Citi Guam Bronze awardees are: Fabrienne Atalig, Rosemary Atalig, Ruby De Lima, Ma. Consuelo (Moral) Mayers, Shaun M. Murphy and Mary P. Sablan.
tag-4: Agustin Davalos, Citi Country Officer/Country Business Manager, Citi Guam, said, "It is a privilege working with a team of dedicated employees – not only in their work but also in living out the Citi Value of Acting in the Best Interest of Clients and Communities. Congratulations to our awardees. Thank you to all our employee volunteers, their families and friends, and to Guam community partners for giving us opportunities to share our talents, skills and time."
tag-5: An awards ceremony will be held at the Citibank branch lobby on Thursday, September 5 at 5 p.m. with special guests Lt. Governor Ray Tenorio; Alfredo Antolin Jr, Director, AHRD; Doris Aguon, Executive Director of Serve Guam!Commission; and Denise Ryan Selk, Chairperson of the Guam Workforce Investment Board.
tag-6: "Congratulations to the awardees, and thank you to all the Citibank Guam volunteers for sharing your time in many volunteer-based projects," added Doris Aguon, Executive Director, Serve Guam!Commission.
tag-7: Citi Guam employees alone donated more than 1,900 volunteer hours in 2012; together with their families and friends, they accumulated more than 2,900 hours. The six awardees cumulatively accounted for 844 hours (43 percent of the total employees' hours). More than 80 percent of Citi Guam's employee base gave at least one volunteer hour in 2012.
tag-8: To date, 12 Citi Guam employees have received the President's Volunteer Service Award since 2006.
tag-9: The President's Council on Service and Civic Participation (the Council) was established in 2003 to recognize the valuable contributions volunteers are making in our communities and encourage more people to serve. The Council created the President's Volunteer Service Award program as a way to thank and honor Americans who by their demonstrated commitment and example, inspire others to engage in volunteer service. For more information visit the President's Volunteer Service Award site.
